pages.text: Gigantocapulus was a large Cretaceous limpet gastropod from what is modern day Japan and New Zealand. Gigantocapulus lived a sedentary filter-feeding life, living off a parasitic relationship with Inoceramid clams. Gigantocapulus could grow at least 20 cm in length, though some were able to grow as large as 40 cm. Increased planktic growth from the Upper Jurassic onwards allowed for filter feeding bivalves and gastropods to reach massive sizes.
